page.title: 01SUMMARY-Kirmington & Croxton
page.content: This square lies in the county of South Humberside, close to the southern boundary.It includes parts of the following parishes;_ Croxton, Ulceby, Kirmington, Melton Ross and Brocklesby. The main land use is arable farming, by tenant farmers. There is some industry, Humberside Airport is within 2m of the village, and many recreational facilities. The square contains the villages of Kirmington and Croxton. Kirmington has 350 residents in 125 houses and Croxton has 49 residents in 15 houses (approx). There are also 4 farmsteads well away from the villages An analysis of all persons >16yrs who have worked was attempted, pg.20. 21% of the working population are in agriculture, 14% offices/clerical and 8% in each of haulage and Commerce. Survey by W.I. members of the villages
